   22: %%
   23: %% ct:run("../inets_test", httpc_SUITE).
   24: %%
   25: 
   26: -module(httpc_SUITE).
   27: 
   28: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   29: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
   30: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   31: -include("inets_test_lib.hrl").
   32: -include("http_internal.hrl").
   33: -include("httpc_internal.hrl").
   34: %% Note: This directive should only be used in test suites.
   35: -compile([export_all, nowarn_export_all]).
   36: 
   37: -define(URL_START, "http://").
   38: -define(TLS_URL_START, "https://").
   39: -define(NOT_IN_USE_PORT, 8997).
   40: 
   41: -define(SSL_NO_VERIFY, {ssl, [{verify, verify_none}]}).
   42: 
   43: %% Using hardcoded file path to keep it below 107 characters
   44: %% (maximum length supported by erlang)
   45: -define(UNIX_SOCKET, "/tmp/inets_httpc_SUITE.sock").
   46: 
   47: -record(sslsocket, {fd = nil, pid = nil}).
   48: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   49: %% Common Test interface functions -----------------------------------
   50: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   51: suite() ->
   52:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   53:      {timetrap,{seconds, 30}}
   54:     ].
   55: 
   56: all() ->
   57:     [
   58:      {group, http},
   59:      {group, http_ipv6},
   60:      {group, sim_http},
   61:      {group, sim_http_ipv6},
   62:      {group, http_internal},
   63:      {group, http_unix_socket},
   64:      {group, https},
   65:      {group, sim_https},
   66:      {group, misc},
   67:      {group, sim_mixed} % HTTP and HTTPS sim servers
   68:     ].
   69: 
   70: groups() ->
   71:     [
   72:      {http, [parallel], real_requests()},
   73:      {http_ipv6, [], [request_options]},
   74:      %% process_leak_on_keepalive is depending on stream_fun_server_close
   75:      %% and it shall be the last test case in the suite otherwise cookie
   76:      %% will fail.
   77:      {sim_http, [], only_simulated() ++ server_closing_connection() ++
   78:           [process_leak_on_keepalive]},
   79:      {sim_http_ipv6, [], only_simulated() ++ server_closing_connection()
   80:           % The following two tests are not functional on IPv6 yet:
   81:           % ++ [process_leak_on_keepalive]
   82:           -- [server_closing_connection_on_second_response]
   83:           },
   84:      {http_internal, [], real_requests_esi()},
   85:      {http_internal_minimum_bytes, [], [remote_socket_close_parallel]},
   86:      {http_unix_socket, [], simulated_unix_socket()},
   87:      {https, [], [def_ssl_opt | real_requests()]},
   88:      {sim_https, [], only_simulated()},
   89:      {misc, [parallel], misc()},
   90:      {sim_mixed, [parallel], sim_mixed()}
   91:     ].
   92: 
   93: real_requests()->
   94:     [
   95:      head,
   96:      get,
   97:      get_query_string,
   98:      post,
   99:      delete,
  100:      post_stream,
  101:      patch,
  102:      async,
  103:      pipeline,
  104:      persistent_connection,
  105:      save_to_file,
  106:      save_to_file_async,
  107:      page_does_not_exist,
  108:      emulate_lower_versions,
  109:      headers,
  110:      headers_as_is,
  111:      header_type_0,
  112:      header_type_1,
  113:      header_type_2,
  114:      header_type_3,
  115:      header_type_4,
  116:      header_type_5,
  117:      header_type_6,
  118:      header_type_7,
  119:      header_type_8,
  120:      header_type_9,
  121:      header_type_10,
  122:      header_type_11,
  123:      header_type_12,
  124:      header_type_13,
  125:      header_type_14,
  126:      header_type_15,
  127:      header_type_16,
  128:      header_type_17,
  129:      header_type_18,
  130:      header_type_19,
  131:      header_type_20,
  132:      header_type_21,
  133:      header_type_22,
  134:      header_type_23,
  135:      empty_body,
  136:      stream,
  137:      stream_to_pid,
  138:      stream_through_fun,
  139:      stream_through_mfa,
  140:      streaming_error,
  141:      inet_opts,
  142:      invalid_headers,
  143:      invalid_headers_key,
  144:      invalid_headers_value,
  145:      invalid_body,
  146:      invalid_body_fun,
  147:      invalid_method,
  148:      no_scheme,
  149:      invalid_uri,
  150:      binary_url,
  151:      iolist_body
  152:     ].
  153: 
  154: real_requests_esi() ->
  155:     [slow_connection].
  156: 
  157: simulated_unix_socket() ->
  158:     [unix_domain_socket].
  159: 
  160: only_simulated() ->
  161:     [
  162:      cookie,
  163:      cookie_profile,
  164:      empty_set_cookie,
  165:      invalid_set_cookie,
  166:      trace,
  167:      stream_once,
  168:      stream_single_chunk,
  169:      stream_no_length,
  170:      not_streamed_once,
  171:      stream_large_not_200_or_206,
  172:      no_content_204,
  173:      tolerate_missing_CR,
  174:      userinfo,
  175:      bad_response,
  176:      timeout_redirect,
  177:      internal_server_error,
  178:      invalid_http,
  179:      invalid_chunk_size,
  180:      headers_dummy,
  181:      headers_with_obs_fold,
  182:      headers_conflict_chunked_with_length,
  183:      empty_response_header,
  184:      remote_socket_close,
  185:      remote_socket_close_async,
  186:      transfer_encoding,
  187:      transfer_encoding_identity,
  188:      redirect_loop,
  189:      redirect_moved_permanently,
  190:      redirect_multiple_choises,
  191:      redirect_found,
  192:      redirect_see_other,
  193:      redirect_temporary_redirect,
  194:      redirect_permanent_redirect,
  195:      redirect_relative_uri,
  196:      port_in_host_header,
  197:      redirect_port_in_host_header,
  198:      relaxed,
  199:      multipart_chunks,
  200:      get_space,
  201:      delete_no_body,
  202:      post_with_content_type,
  203:      stream_fun_server_close
  204:     ].
  205: 
  206: server_closing_connection() ->
  207:     [
  208:      server_closing_connection_on_first_response,
  209:      server_closing_connection_on_second_response
  210:     ].
  211: 
  212: misc() ->
  213:     [
  214:      server_does_not_exist,
  215:      timeout_memory_leak,
  216:      wait_for_whole_response,
  217:      post_204_chunked,
  218:      head_chunked_empty_body,
  219:      head_empty_body,
  220:      chunkify_fun
  221:     ].
  222: 
  223: sim_mixed() ->
  224:     [
  225:      redirect_http_to_https,
  226:      redirect_relative_different_port
  227:     ].
  228: 
  229: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  230: 
  231: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  232:     logger:set_primary_config(level, warning),
  233:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  234:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  235:     inets_test_lib:start_apps([inets]),
  236:     ServerRoot = filename:join(PrivDir, "server_root"),
  237:     DocRoot = filename:join(ServerRoot, "htdocs"),
  238:     setup_server_dirs(ServerRoot, DocRoot, DataDir),
  239:     [{server_root, ServerRoot}, {doc_root, DocRoot}  | Config].
  240: 
  241: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  242:     inets_test_lib:stop_apps([inets]),
  243:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  244:     inets_test_lib:del_dirs(PrivDir),
  245:     ok.
  246: 
  247: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  248: init_per_group(misc = Group, Config) ->
  249:     start_apps(Group),
  250:     Inet = inet_version(),
  251:     ok = httpc:set_options([{ipfamily, Inet}]),
  252:     Config;
  253: init_per_group(Group, Config0) when Group =:= sim_https; Group =:= https;
  254:                                     Group =:= sim_mixed ->
  255:     catch crypto:stop(),
  256:     try crypto:start() of
  257:         ok ->
  258:             start_apps(Group),
  259:              httpc:set_options([{keep_alive_timeout, 50000},
  260:                                 {max_keep_alive_length, 5}]),
  261:             do_init_per_group(Group, Config0)
  262:     catch
  263:         _:_ ->
  264:             {skip, "Crypto did not start"}
  265:     end;
  266: init_per_group(http_unix_socket = Group, Config0) ->
  267:     case os:type() of
  268:         {win32,_} ->
  269:             {skip, "Unix Domain Sockets are not supported on Windows"};
  270:         _ ->
  271:             file:delete(?UNIX_SOCKET),
  272:             start_apps(Group),
  273:             Config = proplists:delete(port, Config0),
  274:             {Pid, Port} = server_start(Group, server_config(Group, Config)),
  275:             lists:append([{dummy_server_pid, Pid}, {port, Port}], Config)
  276:     end;
  277: init_per_group(Group, Config0) when Group == http_ipv6;
  278:                                     Group == sim_http_ipv6 ->
  279:     case is_ipv6_supported() of
  280:         true ->
  281:             start_apps(Group),
  282:             Config = proplists:delete(port, Config0),
  283:             Port = server_start(Group, server_config(Group, Config)),
  284:             [{port, Port}, {request_opts, [{socket_opts, [{ipfamily, inet6}]}]} | Config];
  285:         false ->
  286:             {skip, "Host does not support IPv6"}
  287:      end;
  288: init_per_group(Group, Config0) ->
  289:     start_apps(Group),
  290:     Config = proplists:delete(port, Config0),
  291:     Port = server_start(Group, server_config(Group, Config)),
  292:     [{port, Port} | Config].
  293: 
  294: end_per_group(http_unix_socket, Config) ->
  295:     Pid = ?config(dummy_server_pid, Config),
  296:     Pid ! {stop, self()},
  297:     %% request is needed for enforcing dummy server and handlers stop; without a
  298:     %% it, dummy server waits in gen_tcp:accept and will not process stop request
  299:     httpc:request(get, {"http://localhost/v1/kv/foo", []}, [], []),
  300:     receive
  301:         {stopped, _DummyServerPid} ->
  302:             ok
  303:     end,
  304:     file:delete(?UNIX_SOCKET),
  305:     ok;
  306: end_per_group(_, _Config) ->
  307:     ok.
  308: 
  309: do_init_per_group(Group=sim_mixed, Config0) ->
  310:     % The mixed group uses two server ports (http and https), so we use
  311:     % different config names here.
  312:     Config1 = init_ssl(Config0),
  313:     Config2 = proplists:delete(http_port, proplists:delete(https_port, Config1)),
  314:     {HttpPort, HttpsPort} = server_start(Group, server_config(sim_https, Config2)),
  315:     [{http_port, HttpPort} | [{https_port, HttpsPort} | Config2]];
  316: do_init_per_group(Group, Config0) ->
  317:     Config1 =
  318:         case Group of
  319:             https ->
  320:                 init_ssl(Config0);
  321:             sim_https ->
  322:                 init_ssl(Config0);
  323:             _ ->
  324:                 Config0
  325:         end,
  326:     Config = proplists:delete(port, Config1),
  327:     Port = server_start(Group, server_config(Group, Config)),
  328:     [{port, Port} | Config].
  329: 
  330: init_ssl(Config) ->
  331:     ClientFileBase = filename:join([proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), "client"]),
  332:     ServerFileBase = filename:join([proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), "server"]),
  333:     GenCertData =
  334:         public_key:pkix_test_data(#{server_chain =>
  335:                                         #{root => [{key, inets_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(1)},
  336:                                                    {digest, sha256}],
  337:                                           intermediates => [[{key, inets_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(2)},
  338:                                                              {digest, sha256}]],
  339:                                           peer => [{key, inets_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(3)},
  340:                                                    {digest, sha256}]
  341:                                          },
  342:                                     client_chain =>
  343:                                         #{root => [{key, inets_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(4)},
  344:                                                    {digest, sha256}],
  345:                                           intermediates => [[{key, inets_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(5)},
  346:                                                              {digest, sha256}]],
  347:                                           peer => [{key, inets_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(6)},{digest, sha256}]}}),
  348:     Conf = inets_test_lib:gen_pem_config_files(GenCertData, ClientFileBase, ServerFileBase),
  349:     [{ssl_conf, Conf} | Config].
  350: 
  351: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  352: init_per_testcase(pipeline, Config) ->
  353:     inets:start(httpc, [{profile, pipeline}]),
  354:     httpc:set_options([{pipeline_timeout, 50000},
  355:                        {max_pipeline_length, 3}], pipeline),
  356: 
  357:     [{profile, pipeline} | Config];
  358: init_per_testcase(persistent_connection, Config) ->
  359:     inets:start(httpc, [{profile, persistent_connection}]),
  360:     httpc:set_options([{keep_alive_timeout, 50000},
  361: 		       {max_keep_alive_length, 3}], persistent),
  362: 
  363:     [{profile, persistent_connection} | Config];
  364: init_per_testcase(Case, Config) when Case == wait_for_whole_response;
  365:                                      Case == remote_socket_close_parallel ->
  366:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 60*3}),
  367:     Config;
  368: init_per_testcase(Case, Config) when Case == post;
  369: 				     Case == delete;
  370: 				     Case == post_delete;
  371: 				     Case == post_stream ->
  372:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 30}),
  373:     Config;
  374: init_per_testcase(Case, Config) when Case == timeout_memory_leak ->
  375:     {ok, _Pid} = inets:start(httpc, [{profile, Case}]),
  376:     [{profile, Case} | Config];
  377: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
  378:     Config.
  379: 
  380: end_per_testcase(Case, Config) when Case == timeout_memory_leak;
  381:                                     Case == pipeline;
  382:                                     Case == persistent_connection ->
  383:     inets:stop(httpc, ?config(profile, Config));
  384: end_per_testcase(Case, Config)
  385:   when Case == server_closing_connection_on_first_response;
  386:        Case == server_closing_connection_on_second_response ->
  387:     %% Test case uses at most one session.  Ensure no leftover
  388:     %% sessions left behind.
  389:     {_, Status} = proplists:lookup(tc_status, Config),
  390:     ShallCleanup = case Status of
  391:                        ok -> true;
  392:                        {failed, _} -> true;
  393:                        {skipped, _} -> false
  394:                    end,
  395:     if ShallCleanup =:= true ->
  396:             httpc:request(url(group_name(Config), "/just_close.html", Config)),
  397:             ok;
  398:        true ->
  399:             ct:log("Not cleaning up because test case status was ~p", [Status]),
  400:             ok
  401:     end;
  402: end_per_testcase(_Case, _Config) ->
  403:     ok.
  404: 
  405: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  406: %% Test Cases --------------------------------------------------------
  407: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  408: head() ->
  409:     [{doc, "Test http head request against local server."}].
  410: 
  411: head(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  412:     Request  = {url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html", Config), []},
  413:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], []}} = httpc:request(head, Request, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], []).
  414: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  415: get() ->
  416:     [{doc, "Test http get request against local server"}].
  417: get(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  418:     Request  = {url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html", Config), []},
  419:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], Body = [_ | _]}} = httpc:request(get, Request, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], []),
  420: 
  421:     inets_test_lib:check_body(Body),
  422: 
  423:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], BinBody}} =  httpc:request(get, Request, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], [{body_format, binary}]),
  424:     true = is_binary(BinBody).
  425: 
  426: 
  427: get_query_string() ->
  428:     [{doc, "Test http get request with query string against local server"}].
  429: get_query_string(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  430:     Request  = {url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html?foo=bar", Config), []},
  431:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], Body = [_ | _]}} = httpc:request(get, Request, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], []),
  432: 
  433:     inets_test_lib:check_body(Body).
  434: 
  435: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  436: get_space() ->
  437:     [{"Test http get request with '%20' in the path of the URL."}].
  438: get_space(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  439:     Request  = {url(group_name(Config), "/space%20.html", Config), []},
  440:     RequestOpts = proplists:get_value(request_opts, Config, []),
  441:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], Body = [_ | _]}} = httpc:request(get, Request, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], RequestOpts),
  442: 
  443:     inets_test_lib:check_body(Body).
  444: 
  445: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  446: post() ->
  447:     [{"Test http post request against local server. We do in this case "
  448:      "only care about the client side of the the post. The server "
  449:      "script will not actually use the post data."}].
  450: post(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  451:     CGI = case os:type() of
  452: 	      {win32, _} ->
  453: 		  "/cgi-bin/cgi_echo.exe";
  454: 	      _ ->
  455: 		  "/cgi-bin/cgi_echo"
  456: 	  end,
  457: 
  458:      URL = url(group_name(Config), CGI, Config),
  459: 
  460:     %% Cgi-script expects the body length to be 100
  461:     Body = lists:duplicate(100, "1"),
  462: 
  463:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], [_ | _]}} =
  464: 	httpc:request(post, {URL, [{"expect","100-continue"}],
  465: 			     "text/plain", Body}, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], []),
  466: 
  467:     {ok, {{_,504,_}, [_ | _], []}} =
  468: 	httpc:request(post, {URL, [{"expect","100-continue"}],
  469: 			     "text/plain", "foobar"}, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], []).
  470: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  471: delete() ->
  472:     [{"Test http delete request against local server. We do in this case "
  473:      "only care about the client side of the the delete. The server "
  474:      "script will not actually use the delete data."}].
  475: delete(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  476:     CGI = case os:type() of
  477:           {win32, _} ->
  478:           "/cgi-bin/cgi_echo.exe";
  479:           _ ->
  480:           "/cgi-bin/cgi_echo"
  481:       end,
  482: 
  483:     URL  = url(group_name(Config), CGI, Config),
  484:     Body = lists:duplicate(100, "1"),
  485: 
  486:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], [_ | _]}} =
  487:     httpc:request(delete, {URL, [{"expect","100-continue"}],
  488:                  "text/plain", Body}, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], []),
  489: 
  490:     {ok, {{_,504,_}, [_ | _], []}} =
  491:     httpc:request(delete, {URL, [{"expect","100-continue"}],
  492:                  "text/plain", "foobar"}, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], []).
  493: 
  494: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  495: patch() ->
  496:     [{"Test http patch request against local server. We do in this case "
  497:      "only care about the client side of the the patch. The server "
  498:      "script will not actually use the patch data."}].
  499: patch(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  500:     CGI = case os:type() of
  501: 	      {win32, _} ->
  502: 		  "/cgi-bin/cgi_echo.exe";
  503: 	      _ ->
  504: 		  "/cgi-bin/cgi_echo"
  505: 	  end,
  506: 
  507:      URL = url(group_name(Config), CGI, Config),
  508: 
  509:     %% Cgi-script expects the body length to be 100
  510:     Body = lists:duplicate(100, "1"),
  511: 
  512:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], [_ | _]}} =
  513: 	httpc:request(patch, {URL, [{"expect","100-continue"}],
  514: 			     "text/plain", Body}, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], []).
  515: 
  516: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  517: post_stream() ->
  518:     [{"Test streaming http post request against local server. "
  519:      "We only care about the client side of the the post. "
  520:      "The server script will not actually use the post data."}].
  521: post_stream(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  522:     CGI = case os:type() of
  523: 	      {win32, _} ->
  524: 		  "/cgi-bin/cgi_echo.exe";
  525: 	      _ ->
  526: 		  "/cgi-bin/cgi_echo"
  527: 	  end,
  528: 
  529:      URL = url(group_name(Config), CGI, Config),
  530: 
  531:     %% Cgi-script expects the body length to be 100
  532:     BodyFun = fun(0) ->
  533: 		      eof;
  534: 		 (LenLeft) ->
  535: 		      {ok, lists:duplicate(10, "1"), LenLeft - 10}
  536: 	      end,
  537: 
  538:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], [_ | _]}} =
  539: 	httpc:request(post, {URL,
  540: 			     [{"expect", "100-continue"},
  541: 			      {"content-length", "100"}],
  542: 			     "text/plain", {BodyFun, 100}}, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], []),
  543: 
  544:     {ok, {{_,504,_}, [_ | _], []}} =
  545: 	httpc:request(post, {URL,
  546: 			     [{"expect", "100-continue"},
  547: 			      {"content-length", "10"}],
  548: 			     "text/plain", {BodyFun, 10}}, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], []).
  549: 
  550: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  551: trace() ->
  552:     [{doc, "Perform a TRACE request."}].
  553: trace(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  554:     Request  = {url(group_name(Config), "/trace.html", Config), []},
  555:     RequestOpts = proplists:get_value(request_opts, Config, []),
  556:     case httpc:request(trace, Request, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], RequestOpts) of
  557: 	{ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], "TRACE /trace.html" ++ _}} ->
  558: 	    ok;
  559: 	 Other ->
  560: 	    ct:fail({unexpected, Other})
  561:     end.  
  562: 
  563: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  564: 
  565: pipeline(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  566:     Request  = {url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html", Config), []},
  567:     {ok, _} = httpc:request(get, Request, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], [], pipeline),
  568: 
  569:     %% Make sure pipeline session is registered
  570:     ct:sleep(4000),
  571:     keep_alive_requests(Request, pipeline).
  572: 
  573: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  574: 
  575: persistent_connection(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  576:     Request  = {url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html", Config), []},
  577:     {ok, _} = httpc:request(get, Request, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], [], persistent_connection),
  578: 
  579:     %% Make sure pipeline session is registered
  580:     ct:sleep(4000),
  581:     keep_alive_requests(Request, persistent_connection).
  582: 
  583: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  584: async() ->
  585:     [{doc, "Test an asynchrony http request."}].
  586: async(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  587:     Request  = {url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html", Config), []},
  588: 
  589:     {ok, RequestId} =
  590: 	httpc:request(get, Request, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], [{sync, false}]),
  591:     Body =
  592: 	receive
  593: 	    {http, {RequestId, {{_, 200, _}, _, BinBody}}} ->
  594: 		BinBody;
  595: 	    {http, Msg} ->
  596: 		ct:fail(Msg)
  597: 	end,
  598:     inets_test_lib:check_body(binary_to_list(Body)),
  599: 
  600:     {ok, NewRequestId} =
  601: 	httpc:request(get, Request, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], [{sync, false}]),
  602:     ok = httpc:cancel_request(NewRequestId).
  603: 
  604: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  605: save_to_file() ->
  606:     [{doc, "Test to save the http body to a file"}].
  607: save_to_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  608:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  609:     FilePath = filename:join(PrivDir, "dummy.html"),
  610:     URL = url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html", Config),
  611:     Request = {URL, []},
  612:     {ok, saved_to_file}
  613: 	= httpc:request(get, Request, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], [{stream, FilePath}]),
  614:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(FilePath),
  615:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], Body}} = httpc:request(URL),
  616:     Bin == Body.
  617: 
  618: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  619: save_to_file_async() ->
  620:     [{doc,"Test to save the http body to a file"}].
  621: save_to_file_async(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  622:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  623:     FilePath = filename:join(PrivDir, "dummy.html"),
  624:     URL = url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html", Config),
  625:     Request = {URL, []},
  626:     {ok, RequestId} = httpc:request(get, Request, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY],
  627: 				    [{stream, FilePath},
  628: 				     {sync, false}]),
  629:     receive
  630: 	{http, {RequestId, saved_to_file}} ->
  631: 	    ok;
  632: 	{http, Msg} ->
  633: 	    ct:fail(Msg)
  634:     end,
  635: 
  636:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(FilePath),
  637:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], Body}} = httpc:request(URL),
  638:     Bin == Body.
  639: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  640: stream() ->
  641:     [{doc, "Test the option stream for asynchrony requests"}].
  642: stream(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  643:     Request  = {url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html", Config), []},
  644:     RequestOpts = proplists:get_value(request_opts, Config, []),
  645:     stream_test(Request, {stream, self}, RequestOpts).

  648:     [{doc, "Test the option stream for asynchrony requests"}].
  649: stream_once(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  650:     Request0  = {url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html", Config), []},
  651:     RequestOpts = proplists:get_value(request_opts, Config, []),
  652:     stream_test(Request0, {stream, {self, once}}, RequestOpts),
  653: 
  654:     Request1  = {url(group_name(Config), "/once.html", Config), []},
  655:     stream_test(Request1, {stream, {self, once}}, RequestOpts),
  656: 
  657:     Request2  = {url(group_name(Config), "/once_chunked.html", Config), []},
  658:     stream_test(Request2, {stream, {self, once}}, RequestOpts).

  687: not_streamed_once(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  688:     Request0 = {url(group_name(Config), "/404.html", Config), []},

  690:     {404, _} = not_streamed_test(Request0, {stream, {self, once}}, RequestOpts),
  691:     Request1 = {url(group_name(Config), "/404_chunked.html", Config), []},
  692:     {404, _} = not_streamed_test(Request1, {stream, {self, once}}, RequestOpts).

  695: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  696: redirect_multiple_choises() ->
  697:     [{doc, "The user agent, selection of the most appropriate choice MAY "
  698:       "be performed automatically."}].
  699: redirect_multiple_choises(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  700:     URL300 = url(group_name(Config), "/300.html", Config),
  701:     RequestOpts = proplists:get_value(request_opts, Config, []),
  702: 
  703:     catch {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], [_|_]}}
  704: 	= httpc:request(get, {URL300, []}, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], RequestOpts),
  705: 
  706:     {ok, {{_,300,_}, [_ | _], _}} =
  707: 	httpc:request(get, {URL300, []}, [{autoredirect, false},?SSL_NO_VERIFY], RequestOpts).
  708: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  709: redirect_moved_permanently() ->
  710:     [{doc, "The server SHOULD generate a Location header field in the response "
  711:       "containing a preferred URI reference for the new permanent URI.  The user "
  712:       "agent MAY use the Location field value for automatic redirection.  The server's " 
  713:       "response payload usually contains a short hypertext note with a "
  714:       "hyperlink to the new URI(s)."}].
  715: redirect_moved_permanently(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  716: 
  717:     URL301 = url(group_name(Config), "/301.html", Config),
  718:     RequestOpts = proplists:get_value(request_opts, Config, []),
  719: 
  720:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], [_|_]}}
  721: 	= httpc:request(get, {URL301, []}, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], RequestOpts),
  722: 
  723:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], []}}
  724: 	= httpc:request(head, {URL301, []}, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], RequestOpts),
  725: 
  726:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], [_|_]}}
  727: 	= httpc:request(post, {URL301, [],"text/plain", "foobar"},
  728: 			[?SSL_NO_VERIFY], RequestOpts).

  843: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  844: redirect_http_to_https() ->
  845:     [{doc, "Test that a 30X redirect from one scheme to another is handled "
  846:       "correctly."}].
  847: redirect_http_to_https(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  848:     URL301 = mixed_url(http, "/301_custom_url.html", Config),
  849:     TargetUrl = mixed_url(https, "/dummy.html", Config),
  850:     RequestOpts = proplists:get_value(request_opts, Config, []),
  851:     Headers = [{"x-test-301-url", TargetUrl}],
  852: 
  853:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], [_|_]}}
  854: 	= httpc:request(get, {URL301, Headers}, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], RequestOpts),
  855: 
  856:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], []}}
  857: 	= httpc:request(head, {URL301, Headers}, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], RequestOpts),
  858: 
  859:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], [_|_]}}
  860: 	= httpc:request(post, {URL301, Headers, "text/plain", "foobar"},
  861: 			[?SSL_NO_VERIFY], RequestOpts).
  862: 
  863: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  864: redirect_relative_different_port() ->
  865:     [{doc, "Test that a 30X redirect with a relative target, but different "
  866:       "port, is handled correctly."}].
  867: redirect_relative_different_port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  868:     URL301 = mixed_url(http, "/301_custom_url.html", Config),
  869:     RequestOpts = proplists:get_value(request_opts, Config, []),
  870: 
  871:     % We need an extra server of the same protocol here, so spawn a new
  872:     % HTTP-protocol one
  873:     Port = server_start(sim_http, []),
  874:     {ok, Host} = inet:gethostname(),
  875:     % Prefix the URI with '/' instead of a scheme
  876:     TargetUrl = "//" ++ Host ++ ":" ++ integer_to_list(Port) ++ "/dummy.html",
  877:     Headers = [{"x-test-301-url", TargetUrl}],
  878: 
  879:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], [_|_]}}
  880: 	= httpc:request(get, {URL301, Headers}, [], RequestOpts),
  881: 
  882:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], []}}
  883: 	= httpc:request(head, {URL301, Headers}, [], RequestOpts),
  884: 
  885:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], [_|_]}}
  886: 	= httpc:request(post, {URL301, Headers, "text/plain", "foobar"},
  887: 			[], RequestOpts).
  888: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  889: cookie() ->
  890:     [{doc, "Test cookies."}].
  891: cookie(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  892:     ok = httpc:set_options([{cookies, enabled}]),
  893: 
  894:     Request0 = {url(group_name(Config), "/cookie.html", Config), []},
  895:     RequestOpts = proplists:get_value(request_opts, Config, []),
  896: 
  897:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], [_|_]}}
  898: 	= httpc:request(get, Request0, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], RequestOpts),
  899: 
  900:     Request1 = {url(group_name(Config), "/", Config), []},
  901: 
  902:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], [_|_]}} = global:trans(
  903:         {cookies, verify},
  904:         fun() -> httpc:request(get, Request1, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], RequestOpts) end,
  905:         [node()],
  906:         100
  907:     ),
  908: 
  909:    [{session_cookies, [_|_]}] = httpc:which_cookies(httpc:default_profile()),
  910: 
  911:     ok = httpc:set_options([{cookies, disabled}]).
  912: 
  913: 
  914: 
  915: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  916: cookie_profile() ->
  917:     [{doc, "Test cookies on a non default profile."}].
  918: cookie_profile(Config) when is_list(Config) ->   
  919:     inets:start(httpc, [{profile, cookie_test}]),
  920:     ok = httpc:set_options([{cookies, enabled}], cookie_test),
  921: 
  922:     Request0 = {url(group_name(Config), "/cookie.html", Config), []},
  923:     RequestOpts = proplists:get_value(request_opts, Config, []),
  924: 
  925:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], [_|_]}}
  926: 	= httpc:request(get, Request0, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], RequestOpts, cookie_test),
  927: 
  928:     Request1 = {url(group_name(Config), "/", Config), []},
  929: 
  930:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], [_|_]}} = global:trans(
  931:         {cookies, verify},
  932:         fun() -> httpc:request(get, Request1, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], RequestOpts, cookie_test) end,
  933:         [node()],
  934:         100
  935:     ),
  936: 
  937:     inets:stop(httpc, cookie_test).
  938:

 1007: 
 1008: streaming_error(doc) ->
 1009:     [{doc, "Only async requests can be streamed - Solves OTP-8056"}];
 1010: 
 1011: streaming_error(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1012:     Method      = get,
 1013:     Request     = {url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html", Config), []},
 1014:     RequestOpts = [{sync, true} | proplists:get_value(request_opts, Config, [])],
 1015: 
 1016:     {error, streaming_error} = httpc:request(Method, Request, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY],
 1017:                                              [{stream, {self, once}} | RequestOpts]),
 1018: 
 1019:     {error, streaming_error} = httpc:request(Method, Request, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY],
 1020:                                              [{stream, self} | RequestOpts]).
 1021: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1022: 
 1023: server_does_not_exist(doc) ->
 1024:     [{doc, "Test that we get an error message back when the server "
 1025:       "does note exist."}];
 1026: server_does_not_exist(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1027:     {error, _} =
 1028: 	httpc:request(get, {"http://localhost:" ++
 1029: 				integer_to_list(?NOT_IN_USE_PORT)
 1030: 			    ++ "/", []},[?SSL_NO_VERIFY], []).

 1097:     {error, Reason} = httpc:request(get, {URL1, []}, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], RequestOpts),
 1098:

 1111: internal_server_error(doc) ->
 1112:     ["Test 50X codes"];
 1113: internal_server_error(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1114: 
 1115:     URL500 = url(group_name(Config), "/500.html", Config),
 1116:     RequestOpts = proplists:get_value(request_opts, Config, []),
 1117: 
 1118:     {ok, {{_,500,_}, [_ | _], _}}
 1119: 	= httpc:request(get, {URL500, []}, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], RequestOpts),
 1120: 
 1121:     URL503 = url(group_name(Config), "/503.html", Config),
 1122: 
 1123:     %% Used to be able to make the service available after retry.
 1124:     ets:new(unavailable, [named_table, public, set]),
 1125:     ets:insert(unavailable, {503, unavailable}),
 1126: 
 1127:     {ok, {{_,200, _}, [_ | _], [_|_]}} =
 1128: 	httpc:request(get, {URL503, []}, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], RequestOpts),
 1129: 
 1130:     ets:insert(unavailable, {503, long_unavailable}),
 1131: 
 1132:     {ok, {{_,503, _}, [_ | _], [_|_]}} =
 1133: 	httpc:request(get, {URL503, []}, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], RequestOpts),
 1134: 
 1135:     ets:delete(unavailable).

 1199:     {ok, {{_, 200, _}, [_ | _], [_ | _]}} =

 1202: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1203: 
 1204: headers() ->
 1205:     [{doc,"Use as many request headers as possible not used in proxy_headers"}].
 1206: headers(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1207: 
 1208:     URL = url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html", Config),
 1209:     RequestOpts = proplists:get_value(request_opts, Config, []),
 1210:     DocRoot = proplists:get_value(doc_root, Config),
 1211: 
 1212:     {ok, FileInfo} =
 1213: 	file:read_file_info(filename:join([DocRoot,"dummy.html"])),
 1214:     CreatedSec =
 1215: 	calendar:datetime_to_gregorian_seconds(
 1216: 	  FileInfo#file_info.mtime),
 1217: 
 1218:     Mod = httpd_util:rfc1123_date(
 1219: 	    calendar:gregorian_seconds_to_datetime(
 1220: 	      CreatedSec-1)),
 1221: 
 1222:     Date = httpd_util:rfc1123_date({date(), time()}),
 1223: 
 1224:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], [_ | _]}} =
 1225: 	httpc:request(get, {URL, [{"If-Modified-Since",
 1226: 				   Mod},
 1227: 				  {"From","webmaster@erlang.se"},
 1228: 				  {"Date", Date}
 1229: 				 ]}, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], RequestOpts),
 1230: 
 1231:     Mod1 =  httpd_util:rfc1123_date(
 1232: 	      calendar:gregorian_seconds_to_datetime(
 1233: 		CreatedSec+1)),
 1234: 
 1235:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], [_ | _]}} =
 1236: 	httpc:request(get, {URL, [{"If-UnModified-Since",
 1237: 				   Mod1}
 1238: 				 ]}, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], RequestOpts),
 1239: 
 1240:     Tag = httpd_util:create_etag(FileInfo),
 1241: 
 1242: 
 1243:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], [_ | _]}} =
 1244: 	httpc:request(get, {URL, [{"If-Match",
 1245: 				   Tag}
 1246: 				 ]}, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], RequestOpts),
 1247: 
 1248:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], _}} =
 1249: 	httpc:request(get, {URL, [{"If-None-Match",
 1250: 				   "NotEtag,NeihterEtag"},
 1251: 				  {"Connection", "Close"}
 1252: 				 ]}, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], RequestOpts).
 1253: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1254: headers_dummy() ->
 1255:     ["Test the code for handling headers we do not want/can send "
 1256:      "to a real server. Note it is not logical to send"
 1257:      "all of these headers together, we only want to test that"
 1258:      "the code for handling headers will not crash."].
 1259: 
 1260: headers_dummy(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1261: 
 1262:     URL = url(group_name(Config), "/dummy_headers.html", Config),
 1263:     RequestOpts = proplists:get_value(request_opts, Config, []),
 1264: 
 1265:     Foo = http_chunk:encode("foobar") ++
 1266: 	binary_to_list(http_chunk:encode_last()),
 1267:     FooBar =  Foo ++ "\r\n\r\nOther:inets_test\r\n\r\n",
 1268: 
 1269:     UserPasswd = base64:encode_to_string("Alladin:Sesame"),
 1270:     Auth = "Basic " ++ UserPasswd,
 1271: 
 1272:     %% The dummy server will ignore the headers, we only want to test
 1273:     %% that the client header-handling code. This would not
 1274:     %% be a valid http-request!
 1275:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], [_|_]}} =
 1276: 	httpc:request(post,
 1277: 		     {URL,
 1278: 		      [{"Via",
 1279: 			"1.0 fred, 1.1 nowhere.com (Apache/1.1)"},
 1280: 		       {"Warning","1#pseudonym foobar"},
 1281: 		       {"Vary","*"},
 1282: 		       {"Upgrade","HTTP/2.0"},
 1283: 		       {"Pragma", "1#no-cache"},
 1284: 		       {"Cache-Control", "no-cache"},
 1285: 		       {"Connection", "close"},
 1286: 		       {"Date", "Sat, 29 Oct 1994 19:43:31 GMT"},
 1287: 		       {"Accept", " text/plain; q=0.5, text/html"},
 1288: 		       {"Accept-Language", "en"},
 1289: 		       {"Accept-Encoding","chunked"},
 1290: 		       {"Accept-Charset", "ISO8859-1"},
 1291: 		       {"Authorization", Auth},
 1292: 		       {"Expect", "1#100-continue"},
 1293: 		       {"User-Agent","inets"},
 1294: 		       {"Transfer-Encoding","chunked"},
 1295: 		       {"Range", " bytes=0-499"},
 1296: 		       {"If-Range", "Sat, 29 Oct 1994 19:43:31 GMT"},
 1297: 		       {"If-Match", "*"},
 1298: 		       {"Content-Type", "text/plain"},
 1299: 		       {"Content-Length", "6"},
 1300: 		       {"Content-Language", "en"},
 1301: 		       {"Content-Location", "http://www.foobar.se"},
 1302: 		       {"Content-MD5",
 1303: 			"104528739076276072743283077410617235478"},
 1304: 		       {"Content-Range", "bytes 0-499/1234"},
 1305: 		       {"Allow", "GET"},
 1306: 		       {"Proxy-Authorization", Auth},
 1307: 		       {"Expires", "Sat, 29 Oct 1994 19:43:31 GMT"},
 1308: 		       {"Upgrade", "HTTP/2.0"},
 1309: 		       {"Last-Modified", "Sat, 29 Oct 1994 19:43:31 GMT"},
 1310: 		       {"Trailer","1#User-Agent"}
 1311: 		      ], "text/plain", FooBar},
 1312: 		     [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], RequestOpts).
 1313: 
 1314:

 1317: headers_with_obs_fold(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1318:     Request = {url(group_name(Config), "/obs_folded_headers.html", Config), []},
 1319:     RequestOpts = proplists:get_value(request_opts, Config, []),
 1320:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, Headers, [_|_]}} = httpc:request(get, Request, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], RequestOpts),
 1321:     "a b" = proplists:get_value("folded", Headers).
 1322:

 1324: 
 1325: headers_conflict_chunked_with_length(doc) ->
 1326:     ["Test the code for handling headers with both Transfer-Encoding"
 1327:      "and Content-Length which must receive error in default (not relaxed) mode"
 1328:      "and must receive successful response in relaxed mode"];
 1329: headers_conflict_chunked_with_length(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1330:     Request = {url(group_name(Config), "/headers_conflict_chunked_with_length.html", Config), []},
 1331:     RequestOpts = proplists:get_value(request_opts, Config, []),
 1332:     {error, {could_not_parse_as_http, _}} = httpc:request(get, Request, [{relaxed, false}, ?SSL_NO_VERIFY], RequestOpts),
 1333:     {ok,{{_,200,_},_,_}} = httpc:request(get, Request, [{relaxed, true}, ?SSL_NO_VERIFY], RequestOpts),
 1334:     ok.
 1335: 
 1336: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1337: invalid_headers(doc) ->
 1338:     ["Test invalid header format"];
 1339: invalid_headers(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1340:     URL = url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html", Config),
 1341:     RequestOpts = proplists:get_value(request_opts, Config, []),
 1342:     {error,{invalid_header,{"headers",
 1343:                             [{"user-agent","httpc"}]}}}	=
 1344:         httpc:request(get, {URL, [{"headers", [{"user-agent", "httpc"}]}]},
 1345:                                   [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], RequestOpts).
 1346: 
 1347: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1348: invalid_headers_key(Config) ->
 1349:     Request  = {url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html", Config),
 1350:                 [{cookie, "valid cookie"}]},
 1351:     RequestOpts = proplists:get_value(request_opts, Config, []),
 1352:     {error, {headers_error, invalid_field}} =
 1353:         httpc:request(get, Request, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], RequestOpts).
 1354: 
 1355: invalid_headers_value(Config) ->
 1356:     Request  = {url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html", Config),
 1357:                 [{"cookie", atom_value}]},
 1358:     RequestOpts = proplists:get_value(request_opts, Config, []),
 1359:     {error, {headers_error, invalid_value}} =
 1360:         httpc:request(get, Request, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], RequestOpts).
 1361: 
 1362: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1363: 
 1364: %% Doc not generated, but we can live without that.  It should be
 1365: %%  [{doc, "Header type test"}].
 1366: -define(HDR_TYPE_TEST(Name, Method, Value),
 1367:         Name(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1368:             test_header_type(Config, Method, Value)).
 1369: 
 1370: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_0, get, "stringheader").
 1371: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_1, get, <<"binary">>).
 1372: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_2, get, ["an", <<"iolist">>]).
 1373: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_3, head, "stringheader").
 1374: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_4, head, <<"binary">>).
 1375: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_5, head, ["an", <<"iolist">>]).
 1376: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_6, post, "stringheader").
 1377: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_7, post, <<"binary">>).
 1378: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_8, post, ["an", <<"iolist">>]).
 1379: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_9, put, "stringheader").
 1380: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_10, put, <<"binary">>).
 1381: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_11, put, ["an", <<"iolist">>]).
 1382: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_12, delete, "stringheader").
 1383: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_13, delete, <<"binary">>).
 1384: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_14, delete, ["an", <<"iolist">>]).
 1385: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_15, trace, "stringheader").
 1386: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_16, trace, <<"binary">>).
 1387: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_17, trace, ["an", <<"iolist">>]).
 1388: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_18, patch, "stringheader").
 1389: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_19, patch, <<"binary">>).
 1390: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_20, patch, ["an", <<"iolist">>]).
 1391: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_21, options, "stringheader").
 1392: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_22, options, <<"binary">>).
 1393: ?HDR_TYPE_TEST(header_type_23, options, ["an", <<"iolist">>]).
 1394: 
 1395: test_header_type(Config, Method, Value) ->
 1396:     {Method, Value, {ok, _Data}} =
 1397:         {Method, Value,
 1398:          httpc:request(Method,
 1399:                       make_request(Config, Method, Value),
 1400:                       [?SSL_NO_VERIFY],
 1401:                       [])}.
 1402: 
 1403: make_request(Config, Method, Value) ->
 1404:     URL = url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html", Config),
 1405:     Headers = [{"other-header", Value},
 1406:                {"user-agent", Value}],
 1407:     %% Generate request with or without body, depending on method.
 1408:     case method_type(Method) of
 1409:         read ->
 1410:             {URL, Headers};
 1411:         write ->
 1412:             {URL, Headers, "text/plain", ""}
 1413:     end.
 1414: 
 1415: method_type(Method) ->
 1416:     case Method of
 1417:         get -> read;
 1418:         head -> read;
 1419:         options -> read;
 1420:         trace -> read;
 1421:         post -> write;
 1422:         put -> write;
 1423:         delete -> write;
 1424:         patch -> write
 1425:     end.
 1426: 
 1427: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1428: 
 1429: invalid_body(Config) ->
 1430:     URL = url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html", Config),
 1431:     {error, invalid_request} =
 1432:         httpc:request(post, {URL, [], <<"text/plain">>, "foobar"},
 1433:                       [], []).
 1434: 
 1435: invalid_body_fun(Config) ->
 1436:     URL = url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html", Config),
 1437:     BodyFun = fun() -> body_part end,
 1438:     {error, {bad_body_generator, _}} =
 1439:         httpc:request(post, {URL, [], "text/plain", {BodyFun, init}},
 1440:                       [], []).
 1441: 
 1442: 
 1443: invalid_method(Config) ->
 1444:     URL = url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html", Config),
 1445:     {error, invalid_method} =
 1446:         httpc:request(past, {URL, [], <<"text/plain">>, "foobar"},
 1447:                       [], []).
 1448: 
 1449: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1450: 
 1451: binary_url(Config) ->
 1452:     URL = uri_string:normalize(url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html", Config)),
 1453:     case group_name(Config) of
 1454:         https -> ok;
 1455:         _ -> {ok, _Response} = httpc:request(unicode:characters_to_binary(URL))
 1456:     end.
 1457: 
 1458: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1459: 
 1460: iolist_body(_Config) ->
 1461:     {ok, ListenSocket} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{active,once}, binary]),
 1462:     {ok,{_,Port}} = inet:sockname(ListenSocket),
 1463: 
 1464:     ProcessHeaders = 
 1465:         fun 
 1466:             F([], Acc) ->
 1467:                 Acc;
 1468:             F([Line|Tail], Acc0) ->
 1469:                 Acc1 = 
 1470:                     case binary:split(Line, <<": ">>, [trim_all]) of
 1471:                         [Key, Value] ->
 1472:                             Acc0#{Key => Value};
 1473:                         _ ->
 1474:                             Acc0
 1475:                     end,
 1476:                 F(Tail, Acc1)
 1477:         end,
 1478:     
 1479:     proc_lib:spawn(fun() ->
 1480:         {ok, Accept} = gen_tcp:accept(ListenSocket),
 1481:         receive
 1482:             {tcp, Accept, Msg} ->
 1483:                 ct:log("Message received: ~p", [Msg]),
 1484:                 [_HeadLine | HeaderLines] = binary:split(Msg, <<"\r\n">>, [global]),
 1485:                 Headers = ProcessHeaders(HeaderLines, #{}),
 1486:                 ContentLength = maps:get(<<"content-length">>, Headers, "-1"),
 1487:                 gen_tcp:send(Accept, [
 1488:                     "HTTP/1.1 200 OK\r\n",
 1489:                     "\r\n",
 1490:                     ContentLength
 1491:                 ])
 1492:         after
 1493:             1000 ->
 1494:                 ct:fail("Timeout: did not receive packet")
 1495:         end
 1496:     end),
 1497: 
 1498:     {ok, Host} = inet:gethostname(),
 1499:     URL = ?URL_START ++ Host ++ ":" ++ integer_to_list(Port),
 1500:     ReqBody = [
 1501:         <<"abc">>,
 1502:         <<"def">>
 1503:     ],
 1504:     {ok, Resp} = httpc:request(post, {URL, _Headers = [], _ContentType = "text/plain", ReqBody}, [], []),
 1505:     ct:log("Got response ~p", [Resp]),
 1506:     case Resp of
 1507:         {{"HTTP/1.1", 200, "OK"}, [], RespBody} ->
 1508:             ReqBody_ContentLength = list_to_integer([C || C <- RespBody, C =/= $\s]),
 1509:             ?assertEqual(iolist_size(ReqBody), ReqBody_ContentLength);
 1510:         _ ->
 1511:             ct:fail("Didn't receive the correct response")
 1512:     end.
 1513: 
 1514: 
 1515: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1516: 
 1517: no_scheme(_Config) ->
 1518:     {error,{bad_scheme,"ftp"}} = httpc:request("ftp://foobar"),
 1519:     {error,{no_scheme}} = httpc:request("//foobar"),
 1520:     {error,{no_scheme}} = httpc:request("foobar"),
 1521:     ok.
 1522: 
 1523: 
 1524: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1525: 
 1526: invalid_uri(Config) ->
 1527:     URL = url(group_name(Config), "/bar?x[]=a", Config),
 1528:     {error, invalid_uri} = httpc:request(URL),
 1529:     ok.
 1530:

 1532: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1533: remote_socket_close(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1534:     URL = url(group_name(Config), "/just_close.html", Config),
 1535:     RequestOpts = proplists:get_value(request_opts, Config, []),
 1536:     {error, socket_closed_remotely} = httpc:request(get, {URL, []}, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], RequestOpts).
 1537: 
 1538: 
 1539: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1540: 
 1541: remote_socket_close_async(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1542:     Request = {url(group_name(Config), "/just_close.html", Config), []},
 1543:     RequestOpts = proplists:get_value(request_opts, Config, []),
 1544:     Options     = [{sync, false} | RequestOpts],
 1545:     Profile     = httpc:default_profile(),
 1546:     {ok, RequestId} =
 1547: 	httpc:request(get, Request, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], Options, Profile),
 1548:     receive
 1549: 	{http, {RequestId, {error, socket_closed_remotely}}} ->
 1550: 	    ok
 1551:     end.
 1552: 
 1553: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1554: 
 1555: process_leak_on_keepalive(Config) ->
 1556:     Request  = {url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html", Config), []},
 1557:     RequestOpts = proplists:get_value(request_opts, Config, []),
 1558:     HttpcHandlers0 = supervisor:which_children(httpc_handler_sup),
 1559:     {ok, {{_, 200, _}, _, Body}} = httpc:request(get, Request, [], RequestOpts),
 1560:     HttpcHandlers1 = supervisor:which_children(httpc_handler_sup),
 1561:     ChildrenCount = supervisor:count_children(httpc_handler_sup),
 1562:     %% Assuming that the new handler will be selected for keep_alive
 1563:     %% which could not be the case if other handlers existed
 1564:     [{undefined, Pid, worker, [httpc_handler]}] =
 1565:         ordsets:to_list(
 1566:           ordsets:subtract(ordsets:from_list(HttpcHandlers1),
 1567:                            ordsets:from_list(HttpcHandlers0))),
 1568:     State = sys:get_state(Pid),
 1569:     #session{socket=Socket} = element(3, State),
 1570:     gen_tcp:close(Socket),
 1571: 
 1572:     {ok, {{_, 200, _}, _, Body}} = httpc:request(get, Request, [], RequestOpts),
 1573:     %% bad handler with the closed socket should get replaced by
 1574:     %% the new one, so children count should stay the same
 1575:     ChildrenCount = supervisor:count_children(httpc_handler_sup),
 1576:     ok.
 1577: 
 1578: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1579: 
 1580: stream_to_pid(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1581:     ReceiverPid = create_receiver(pid),
 1582:     Receiver    = ReceiverPid,
 1583: 
 1584:     stream(ReceiverPid, Receiver, Config),
 1585: 
 1586:     stop_receiver(ReceiverPid).
 1587: 
 1588: stream_through_fun(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1589:     ReceiverPid = create_receiver(function),
 1590:     Receiver = stream_deliver_fun(ReceiverPid),
 1591: 
 1592:     stream(ReceiverPid, Receiver, Config),
 1593: 
 1594:     stop_receiver(ReceiverPid).
 1595: 
 1596: stream_through_mfa(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1597:     ReceiverPid = create_receiver(mfa),
 1598:     Receiver    = {?MODULE, stream_deliver, [mfa, ReceiverPid]},
 1599: 
 1600:     stream(ReceiverPid, Receiver, Config).
 1601: 
 1602: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1603: 
 1604: inet_opts(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1605:     MaxSessions      = 5,
 1606:     MaxKeepAlive     = 10,
 1607:     KeepAliveTimeout = timer:minutes(2),
 1608:     ConnOptions = [{max_sessions,          MaxSessions},
 1609: 		   {max_keep_alive_length, MaxKeepAlive},
 1610: 		   {keep_alive_timeout,    KeepAliveTimeout}],
 1611:     httpc:set_options(ConnOptions),
 1612: 
 1613:     Request  = {url(group_name(Config), "/dummy.html", Config), []},
 1614:     Timeout      = timer:seconds(5),
 1615:     ConnTimeout  = Timeout + timer:seconds(5),
 1616:     HttpOptions = [{timeout, Timeout}, {connect_timeout, ConnTimeout}, ?SSL_NO_VERIFY],
 1617:     Options0     = [{socket_opts, [{tos,    87},
 1618: 				   {recbuf, 16#FFFF},
 1619: 				   {sndbuf, 16#FFFF}]}],
 1620: 
 1621:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], ReplyBody0 = [_ | _]}} = httpc:request(get, Request, HttpOptions, Options0),
 1622:     inets_test_lib:check_body(ReplyBody0),
 1623: 
 1624:     Options1 = [{socket_opts, [{tos,    84},
 1625: 			       {recbuf, 32#1FFFF},
 1626: 			       {sndbuf, 32#1FFFF}]}],
 1627:     {ok, {{_,200,_}, [_ | _], ReplyBody1 = [_ | _]}} = httpc:request(get, Request, [?SSL_NO_VERIFY], Options1),
 1628:     inets_test_lib:check_body(ReplyBody1).
 1629:

 1636:     inets_test_lib:check_body(Body).

 1649:     {ok, Ref} = httpc:request(get, Request, [], [{sync, false}, {stream, self} | RequestOpts]),
 1650:     ok = receive_stream_n(Ref, 10),
 1651:     httpc:cancel_request(Ref).

 1653: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1654: timeout_memory_leak() ->
 1655:     [{doc, "Check OTP-8739"}].
 1656: timeout_memory_leak(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1657:     {_DummyServerPid, Port} = otp_8739_dummy_server(),
 1658:     {ok, Host} = inet:gethostname(),
 1659:     Request = {?URL_START ++ Host ++ ":" ++ integer_to_list(Port) ++ "/dummy.html", []},
 1660:     Profile = ?config(profile, Config),
 1661:     case httpc:request(get, Request, [{connect_timeout, 500}, {timeout, 1}], [{sync, true}], Profile) of
 1662: 	{error, timeout} ->
 1663: 	    %% And now we check the size of the handler db
 1664: 	    Info = httpc:info(Profile),
 1665: 	    ct:log("Info: ~p", [Info]),
 1666: 	    {value, {handlers, Handlers}} =
 1667: 		lists:keysearch(handlers, 1, Info),
 1668: 	    case Handlers of
 1669: 		[] ->
 1670: 		    ok;
 1671: 		_ ->
 1672: 		    ct:fail({unexpected_handlers, Handlers})
 1673: 	    end;
 1674: 	Unexpected ->
 1675: 	    ct:fail({unexpected, Unexpected})
 1676:     end.
 1677:
